description: TO ADMIT MR. TRACY OF CONN. TO TAKE THE OATH REQUIRED BY THE CONSTITUTION.
TO AGREE TO THE FIRST PART OF THE REPORT AS AMENDED, CONCERNING THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE FRENCH REPUBLIC.
TO AGREE TO THE SECOND PART OF A REPORT, AS AMENDED, CONCERNING THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE FRENCH REPUBLIC.

TO RECONSIDER THE RESOLUTION THAT ANY STENOGRAPHER DESIROUS TO TAKE THE DEBATES OF THE SENATE ON LEGISLATIVE BUSINESS, MAY BE ADMITTED FOR THAT PURPOSE AT SUCH PLACE, WITHIN THE AREA OF THE SENATE CHAMBER AS THE PRESIDENT MAY ALLOT.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION ADMITTING STENOGRAPHERS IN THE SENATE BY PROVIDING THAT THEY GIVE A BOND FOR THEIR GOOD CONDUCT.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION AS AMENDED, ADMITTING STENOGRAPHERS INTO THE SENATE.
TO PASS THE H.R. BILL (APP. 1-14-1802, 2 STAT. 128), FIXING THE RATIO OF REPRESENTATION IN THE HOUSE AT ONE MEMBER FOR EVERY 33,000 PERSONS IN EACH STATE.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION REGARDING REPEAL OF AN ACT OF CONGRESS OF 2-13-01, ENTITLED:  "AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE COURT OF THE UNITED STATES", SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT THE WORD "REPEALED", AND TO INSERT THE WORDS "RVISED AND AMENDED."
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION THAT THE ACT OF CONGRESS (APP. 2-13-01), ENTITLED "AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR THE MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE COURTS OF THE UNITED STATES," OUGHT TO BE REPEALED.

TO EXPUNGE FROM THE BILL (APP. 2-3-02, 6 STAT. L. 45), AUTHORIZING THE DISCHARGE OF LAWRENCE ERB FROM HIS CONFINEMENT  THE LAST PROVISO, THAT THE SAID JUDGEMENT SHALL REMAIN IN FORCE AGAINST ANY ESTATE, REAL OR PERSONAL, WHICH THE SAID ERB MAY HEREAFTER CQUIRE, AND THAT PROCESS MAY AT ANY TIME BE ISSUED AGAINST THE SAME.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL, (APP. 2-5-02, 6 STAT. L. 45), AUTHORIZING THE DISCHARGE OF LAWRENCE ERB FROM HIS CONFINEMENT.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JAMES LYNN OF N.J. AS SUPERVISOR FOR THE DISTRICT OF N.J.

TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE THE BILL (APP. 3-8-02, 2 STAT. L. 132), REPEALING CERTAIN ACTS RESPECTING THE ORGANIZATION OF U.S. COURTS; WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO CONSIDER AND REPORT THE ALTERATIONS WHICH MAY BE PROPER IN THE JUDICIARY SYSTEM AND THE PROVISIN TO BE MADE RESPECTING THE JUDGES OF THE CIRCUIT COURTS, ESTABLISHED BY THE ACT OF 2-13-01, IN CASE THE SAID ACT SHALL BE REPEALED.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE FEDERAL JUDICIARY SYSTEM BILL.
TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE THE "FEDERAL JUDICIARY SYSTEM" WITH INSTRUCTIONS THAT SAID COMMITTEE CONSIDER AND REPORT THE ALTERATIONS WHICH MAY BE PROPER IN THE JUDICIARY SYSTEM.
TO DISCHARGE THE SELECT COMMITTEE FROM CONSIDERATION OF THE FEDERAL JUDICIARY SYSTEM BILL.
TO PASS THE FEDERAL JUDICIARY SYSTEM BILL.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL, (APP. 4-14-02, 2 STAT. L. 152), AUTHORIZING THE SETTLEMENT OF THE ACCOUNT OF SAMUEL DEXTER, FOR HIS EXPENSES IN DEFENDING AGAINST THE SUIT OF JOSEPH HODGSON.
TO PASS H.R. BILL (APP. 3-6-02, 6 STAT. L. 45), PROVIDING FOR THE RELIEF OF LYON LEHMAN.
TO AMEND THE FIRST SECTION OF THE FEDERAL JUDICIARY SYSTEM BILL, BY ADDING "EXCEPTING SO MUCH THEREOF AS RELATES TO THE COURTS THEREBY ESTABLISHED IN THE THIRD DISTRICT."
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE BILL TO ALLOW A DRAWBACK OF DUTIES ON GOODS EXPORTED TO NEW ORLEANS, AND TO AMEND THE ACT TO REGULATE THE COLLECTION OF DUTIES ON IMPORTS AND TONNAGE.
TO PASS, AS AMENDED, THE BILL (APP. 3-16-02, 2 STAT. L. 132) FIXING THE MILITARY PEACE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE U.S.

TO APPOINT A COMMITTEE TO INQUIRE WHETHER ANY, AND WHAT AMENDMENTS ARE NECESSARY TO BE MADE IN THE ACT (APP. 4-30-02, 2 STAT. L. 150), ESTABLISHING THE JUDICIAL COURTS OF THE U.S. AND TO REPORT BY BILL OR OTHERWISE.

TO AMEND THE BILL (APP. 3-30-02, 2 STAT. L. 139), TO REGULATE TRADE AND INTERCOURSE WITH THE INDIAN TRIBES AND TO PRESERVE PEACE ON THE FRONTIERS, BY INSERTING IN THE 16TH SECTION THE WORDS:  "UNLESS UPON SPECIAL CAUSE TO BE CERTIFIED BY THE COMMANDING OFICERS."

TO ADOPT THE COMMITTEE'S REPORT CONCERNING THE BILL, (APP. 4-6-02, 2 STAT. L. 148), REPEALING THE INTERNAL TAXES, SAID REPORT TO ELIMINATE THE EIGHTH SECTION PROVIDING REBATE ON TAXES PAID ON BLANKS, VELLUM, PARCHMENT OR PAPER, DEDUCTING THE TAX OF 17 1/ % NOW DUE PROVIDED SUCH CLAIM IS PRESENTED BEFORE OCT
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL, FOR THE BETTER SECURITY OF PUBLIC MONEYS AND PROPERTY IN THE HANDS OF PUBLIC OFFICERS AND AGENTS.
TO AMEND THE BILL RELATING TO "INTERNAL TAXES", BY MAKING THE DEDUCTION ON THE REFUND OF STAMPS SUBJECT TO A DEDUCTION OF ONLY 7 1/2% INSTEAD OF 17 1/2% AS PROVIDED.
TO PASS THE INTERNAL TAXES, BILL.
TO PASS THE H.R. BILL (APP. 4-14-02, 2 STAT. L. 155), TO REVISE AND AMEND THE NATURALIZATION LAW, AS AMENDED.

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-14-02, 2 STAT. L. 152), REVIVING AND CONTINUING IN FORCE AN ACT ENTITLED, "AN ACT TO AUGMENT THE SALARIES OF THE OFFICERS THEREIN MENTIONED" (APP. 3-2-1799), SAID AMENDMENT TO PROVIDE A NEW SCHEDULE OF SALARIES FOR HIGH RAKING APPOINTED GOVERNMENT OFFICERS.
TO ADOPT A MOTION TO APPOINT A COMMITTEE TO EXAMINE AND REPORT WHAT REGULATIONS OUGHT TO BE ADOPTED RESPECTING THE LANDS CLAIMED BY THE UNITED STATES WITHIN THE STATE OF TENNESSEE.

TO AMEND THE S. BILL (APP. 4-29-02, 2 STAT, L. 156), PROVIDING FOR THE MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE U.S. COURTS, SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE ELEVENTH SECTION PROPOSING THAT THERE BE APPOINTED BY THE PRESIDENT FROM TIME TO TIME, AS MANY GENERALCOMMISSIONERS OF BANKRUPTCY IN EACH DISTRICT OF THE UNITED STATES AS HE MAY DEEM NECESSARY.
TO PASS THE BILL (APP. 4-29-05, 2 STAT. L. 156), PROVIDING FOR THE MORE CONVENIENT ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED STATES COURTS.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-14-02, 2 STAT. 6. 152), REVIVING AND CONTINUING IN FORCE AN ACT TO AUGMENT THE SALARIES OF OFFICERS THEREIN MENTIONED.
TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF CONELIUS LYMAN AS A CAPTAIN OF INFANTRY.

TO AMEND THE S. RESOLUTION REGARDING LANDS CLAIMED BY THE UNITED STATES WITHIN THE STATE OF TENNESSEE, SAID AMENDMENT TO ADD IN DESIGNATION OF THE LANDS CLAIMED BY THE U.S. WITHIN TENNESSEE, THOSE TO WHICH THE INDIAN CLAIMS ARE EXTINGISHED AND WHICH ARE OT COVERED BY LEGAL TITLES UNDER THE STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO DIRECT THE ATTORNEY GENERAL TO HAVE BEFORE CONGRESS AT THE NEXT SESSION, ALL DOCUMENTS RELATIVE TO LAND CLAIMS IN TENNESSEE UNDER A DEED OF CESSION IN DECEMBER 1789, AND THE PROBABLE QUANTITY OF LAND WHCH MAY BE AT THE DISPOSITION OF THE U.S

TO AMEND A HOUSE BILL (APP. 5-3-02, 2 STAT. L. 189), TO FURTHER ALTER AND ESTABLISH CERTAIN POST ROADS, SAID AMEND- MENT TO MAKE IT AN OFFENSE TO REFUSE THE RIGHT OF WAY WHEN POSSIBLE TO VEHICLES CARRYING MAIL, AND TO MAKE IT PUNISHABLE BY A FINE OF NOT ORE THAN $30

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-29-02, 2 STAT. L. 167), PRO- VIDING FOR THE REDEMPTION OF THE PUBLIC DEBT, BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION ONE, "AND ALSO FUTURE LOANS WHICH MAY BE MADE REIMBURSING OR REDEEMING ANY INSTALLMENT OR PARTS OF THE PRINCIPAL OF THESAID DEBTS."
TO AMEND THE REDEMPTION OF THE PUBLIC DEBT BILL, SAID AMEND- MENT TO STRIKE OUT THE FIFTH SECTION THE WORDS, "OR ANY INDIVIDUAL OR INDIVIDUALS."
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE BILL, TO ESTABLISH THE GOVERNMENT OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO AMEND THE REDEMPTION OF THE PUBLIC DEBT BILL BY APPROP- RIATING TO THE SINKING FUND YEARLY, SO MUCH OF THE DUTIES ON MERCHANDISE AND TONNAGE, AS WILL AMOUNT, WITH THE MONEY ALREADY PROVIDED FOR THE SINKING FUND, TO $7,300,000.
TO PASS THE REDEMPTION OF THE PUBLIC DEBT BILL.
TO AGREE TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND GREAT BRITAIN.

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-29-02, 2 STAT. L. 170), FOR THE RELIEF OF WIDOWS AND ORPHANS OF CERTAIN PERSONS DECEASED OR WHO MAY HEREAFTER DIE IN THE NAVAL SERVICE, SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT THE SECOND SECTION WHICH PROVIDES FOR HALF PAY TO SURVIVOS OF ANY WARRANT OR COMMISSIONED OFFICER OF THE NAVY OR MARINES KILLED OR DROWNED WHILE IN SERVICE.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-29-02, 2 STAT. L. 471), FOR THE RELIEF OF THEODOSUIS FOWLER.

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 4-30-02, 2 STAT. L. 173), ENABLING THE PEOPLE OF THE EASTERN DIVISION OF THE TERRITORY NORTHWEST OF THE OHIO RIVER, TO FORM A CONSTITUTION AND STATE GOVERNMENT; SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT CERTAIN PARTS OF THE SIXTH SECTIONPROVIDING THAT THE CONVENTION OF SAID STATE SHALL ASSENT THAT ALL LAND SOLD BY CONGRESS FROM AND AFTER JUNE 30, NEXT, REMAIN TAX FREE OF ANY TAXES, FOR A TERM OF 5 YEARS FROM THE DATE OF SALE.

TO AMEND THE NORTHWEST TERRITORY BILL, BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION SIX, THAT 1/20 OF THE NET PROCEEDS OF LANDS LYING WITHIN SAID STATES, SOLD BY CONGRESS FROM JUNE 13, NEXT, ON, SHALL BE APPLIED FOR CONSTRUCTING PUBLIC ROADS.

TO AMEND THE NORTHWEST TERRITORY BILL, BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION SIX THE PROVISION THAT SIX MILES RESERVATION INCLUDING THE SCIOTO SALT SPRINGS, AND IN THE MILITARY TRACT WITH SECTIONS OF LAND INCLUSIVE, SHALL BE GRANTED TO SAID STATE FOR PUBLIC USE, UDER TERMS, CONDITIONS AND REGULATION OF STATE LEGISLATURE, PROVIDING IT SHALL NEVER BE SOLD OR LEASED FOR A TERM OF MORE THAN TEN YEARS.

TO AMEND THE NORTHWEST TERRITORY BILL BY PREVENTING THE PROPOSED NEW STATE WHEN FORMED, FROM EVER DERIVING REVENUE FROM LEASING CERTAIN TRACKS OF LAND CONTAINING SALT SPRINGS, THUS KEEPING SAID SALT SPRINGS FOR THE FREE USE OF THE PEOPLE.

TO AMEND THE NORTHWEST TERRITORY BILL BY STRIKING OUT FROM THE 6TH SECTION THE WORD, "SOLD", AND INSERTING "GRANTED", SO THAT EVERY TRACT OF LAND GRANTED BY CONGRESS, FROM AND AFTER JUNE 30TH, NEXT, SHALL BE AND REMAIN TAX EXEMPT FOR FIVE YEARS.
TO PASS THE NORTHWESTERN TERRITORY  BILL AS AMENDED.

TO AMEND THE TREATY BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CHICKASAW INDIANS MADE AT CHICKASAW BLUFFS ON 10-24-01, BY ELIMINATING THEREFROM THE WORDS - "TO ASSIST THE CHICKASAWS TO PRESERVE ENTIRE, ALL THEIR RIGHTS AGAINST THE ENCROACHMENTS OF UNJUST NEIGHBORS, OF WHIH HE SHALL BE THE JUDGE".
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION THAT THE SENATE ADVISE AND CONSENT THAT THE PRESIDENT DO RATIFY THE TREATY OF RECIPROCAL ADVANTAGE AND MUTUAL CONVENIENCE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CHICKASAW NATION OF INDIANS.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION THAT THE SENATE ADVISE AND CONSENT TO HAVE THE PRESIDENT RATIFY THE TREATY OF FRIENDSHIP, LIMITS AND ACCOMODATIONS, BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE CHOCTAW NATION OF INDIANS.

TO AMEND THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 5-1-02, 2 STAT. L. 178), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE U.S. NAVY FOR 1802, SAID AMENDMENT TO ADD A NEW SECTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO DISMISS AS MANY OF THE OFFICERS OF THE MARINE CORPS AS WILL REDUCE THIR NUMBER AND GRADES IN LEGAL PRO- PORTION TO THE NUMBER OF MARINES RETAINED IN SERVICE.
TO PASS HOUSE BILL (APP. 5-1-02, 2 STAT. L. 178), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE NAVY FOR 1802.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO APPOINT A COMMITTEE TO BRING IN A BILL REPEALING SO MUCH OF ANY EXISTING LAW AUTHORIZING A CERTAIN PROVISIONARY AGREEMENT, MADY BY COMMISSIONERS OF THE UNITED STATES AND THE STATE OF GEORGIA AND DATED APR. 24, 1802, AND WHICH MY BE BINDING AND CONCLUSIVE ON THE UNITED STATES.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 5-3-02, 2 STAT. L. 195), TO INCORPORATE THE INHABITANTS OF THE CITY OF WASHINGTON IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS THE HOUSE BILL (APP. 5-3-02, 2 STAT. L. 192), FOR THE RELIEF OF SICK AND DISABLED SEAMEN.

TO CONCUR IN THE HOUSE RESOLUTION PROPOSING TWO AMENDMENTS TO THE CONSTITUTION RELATING TO THE ELECTION OF PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT, BY AEVING THE VOTERS DESIGNATE THE PERSONS VOTED FOR AS PRESIDENT AND AS VICE PRESIDENT.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF TREATY MADE AT ALBANY, N.Y., AUG. 20, 1802, BETWEEN THE STATE OF N.Y., AND THE SENECA TRIBE OF INDIANS.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY, MADE UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THE U.S., BETWEEN THE STATE OF N.Y., AND THE ONEIDA NATION OF INDIANS ON 6-4-02.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY OF LIMITS BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CREEK NATION OF INDIANS, MADE ON 6-16-02.

TO POSTPONE TO THE FIRST MONDAY IN DEC. CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL TO CARRY INTO EFFECT VARIOUS CONGRESSIONAL RESOLUTIONS FOR THE ERECTION OF MONUMENTS TO THE MEMORY OF GENERALS WOOSTER, HERKIMER, DAVIDSON, AND SCRIVIN.
TO PASS THE BILL TO CARRY INTO EFFECT THE VARIOUS   ************** CONGRESSIONAL RESOLUTIONS TO ERECT MONUMENTS TO THE MEMORY OF GENERALS WOOSTER, HERKIMER, DAVIDSON, AND SCRIVIN.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY MADE UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THE U.S., BETWEEN THE SENECA NATION OF INDIANS AND WILHEM WILLINK AND OTHERS, OF THE REPUBLIC OF BATAWIA; DATED JUNE 30, 1802.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE CHOCTAW NATION OF INDIANS, MADE ON OCT. 17, 1802.

TO CONSENT TO THE APPOINTMENT OF JAMES MONROE TO BE MINISTER EXTRAORDINARY AND PLENIPOTENTIARY, TO ENTER INTO TREATY ON CONVENTION WITH THE FIRST CONSUL OF FRANCE, FOR ENLARGING AND MORE EFFECTUALLY SECURING OUR RIGHTS AND INTERESTS IN THE MISSISSIPPI RIER.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND SPAIN.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY BETWEEN THE SENECA INDIANS AND OLIVER PHELPS AND OTHERS, MADE ON 6-30-02.

TO AMEND THE BILL MAKING FURTHER PROVISIONS FOR THE EXPENSES ATTENDING THE INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND FOREIGN NATIONS, SAID AMENDMENT TO ELIMINATE THE WORDS: "OF DEFRAYING ANY EXTRAORDINARY EXPENSES WHICH MAY BE INCURRED IN THE INTERCOURSEBETWEEN THE U.S
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE BILL PROVIDING FOR EXPENSES ATTENDING THE INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND FOREIGN NATIONS.
TO PASS THE BILL PROVIDING FOR EXPENSES ATTENDING THE INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE U.S. AND FOREIGN NATIONS.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE SECRETARY OF THE SENATE TO GIVE TO WILLIAM MARBURY, ROBERT T. HOOE, AND DEVIS RAMSAY AN ATTESTED COPY OF THE PROCEEDINGS OF MAR. 2 AND 3, 1801, RELATIVE TO THEIR APPOINTMENT AS JUSTICES OF THE PEACE IN WASHINGTON ANDALEXANDRIA IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT TO CAUSE A "QUO WARRANTO" PROCEEDING TO BE FILED BY THE ATTORNEY GENERAL AGAINST RICHARD BASSET FOR THE PURPOSE OF TESTING THE VALIDITY OF THE ACT OF MAR. 8, 1802, REPEALING THE ACT OF FEB. 13, 1801, ESTABISHING CERTAIN INFERIOR COURTS.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION ASSERTING THE RIGHT OF THE U.S. TO FREE NAVIGATION OF THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER, AND TO A PLACE OF DEPOSIT FOR THEIR PRODUCTS IN THE ISLAND OF NEW ORLEANS, THAT THE LATE INFRACTION OF THAT RIGHT (BY SPAIN) IS A HOSTILE AGGRESSION, ANDAUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO SEIZE SUCH PLACES AS HE MAY DEEM CONVENIENT AND TO SUSTAIN THEIR RIGHTS BY THE MILITIA, FOR WHICH AN APPROPRIATION IS MADE; SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT THE FIRST SECTION ASSERTING THEIR RIGHTS AND CHARACTERIZING THE INFRACTIO...
TO AMEND THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER RESOLUTION, ELIMINATING THE SECOND SECTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO USE THE ARMED FORCES OF THE U.S. TO TAKE POSSESSION OF THE ISLAND OF NEW ORLEANS.

TO AMEND THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER RESOLUTION BY AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO REQUIRE THE EXECUTIVES OF THE SEVERAL STATES TO ARM AND EQUIP 80,000 MILITIA, PROVIDING FOR ONE OR MORE ARSENALS ON THE WESTERN WATERS AND MAKING AN APPROPRIATION THEREFOR.
TO PASS THE AMENDED BILL TO INCORPORATE AN INSURANCE COMPANY IN THE CITY OF WASHINGTON.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE TUSCARORA NATION OF INDIANS, MADE ON DEC. 4, 1802.
TO POSTPONE TO MARCH 4, NEXT,  CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL TO REDUCE THE MARINE CORPS.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE BILL (APP. 3-3-03, 2 STAT. L. 215), TO PROVIDE MORE EFFECTUALLY FOR THE ORGANIZATION OF THE MILITIA OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO PASS THE BILL (APP. 3-3-03, 2 STAT. L. 215), TO PROVIDE MORE EFFECTUALLY FOR THE ORGANIZATION OF THE MILITIA OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND SPAIN CONCLUDED AT MADRID ON AUG. 11, 1802.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE CONVENTION BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND SPAIN CONCLUDED AT MADRID ON AUG. 11, 1802.
TO PASS THE BILL (APP. 3-3-03, 6 STAT. L. 50), FOR JOSHIA HARVEY AND OTHERS, ASKING RELIEF FROM BONDS AS PRINCIPLE AND SECURITIES FOR THE PAYMENT OF DUTIES, HAVING BEEN DISCHARGED FROM BANKRUPTCY.
TO POSTPONE TO MARCH 4, NEXT, CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION FOR THE ELECTION OF THE SECRETARY OF THE SENATE AND OTHER OFFICERS.
